result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David A Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David A Larson was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eau Claire County case 15CM250 dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes: $299.85 represents restitution in read-in of Eau Claire County case 15CM250.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
No contact with:  Teri Jo Denning without prior written permission of the agent and Teri Denning.
Submit a DNA sample.  All contraband to be destroyed.  Non-contraband to be returned.

timeConds.notes: 240 hrs to be completed within 1st 24 months of Probation (this is in lieu of 30 days Jail, to be served 1 day Jail for every 8 hours community service not completed.)  (see Jail comments).
